result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J. Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua J. Mueller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua J. Mueller was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay fine of $500.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Spend 5 months in the county jail w/huber privileges, commencing 7/11/15 @ 8am.  Credit for 60 days served.
*  Make monthly payments to court fees and supervision fees.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges allowed.  Credit for 60 days served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence he is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
ALL UNPAID FINE/COSTS ARE STILL DUE.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Andrea Rufo.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.    Defendant is sentenced to 5 years in the WSP Consecutive to any other sentence he is currently serving; 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years of Extended Supervision.  Credit for 106 days.  DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights given.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Joshua J. Mueller, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.    Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 18 months with conditions concurrent to any other sentence.  As a condition court imposes 5 months in the KCJ commencing on 7/11/15 at 8:00 AM.  Credit for 60 days.  Huber & Work Crew authorized.  Fined $500 plus costs to be paid during probation.  See conditions.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Kristyne Watson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case was scheduled for sentencing hearing today.  At request of Atty Watson, sentencing reset for 7/2/15 at 8:45.  Bond continued.
atty K Watson
filed by atty: K Watson

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Everett King.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - Deft. pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Count 2 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI is ordered.  Arguments heard on DE's motion to reduce bond to a signature bond to allow him to participate in the options program.  Upon hearing arguments court grants motion.  Bond shall be reduced to a $2000 Signature bond with same conditions and DE signed bond in court.  Sentencing on 6/12/15 at 11:00 AM.
